text: my name is David Abramson I'm the CTO at
curve a we're a startup on the AWS
ecosystem our product is designed to be
an analytics layer an embedded analytics
layer for other SAS companies who are
running their SAS products on the AWS
ecosystem so I think there's really two
main trends that we're seeing for SAS
companies in the cloud ecosystem first
is Trend towards serverless I think
that's really important for companies
that want to not only effectively scale
but also keep their costs in check and
then the second trend is really all
about the fact that every application
and every SAS product is becoming a data
product and so having a really effective
data and analytic strategy is becoming
increasingly important to not only grow
your business but also effectively
provide value for your customers Kirby
we started our entire business on the
AWS ecosystem and so for us it was
really all about finding the the right
Cloud environment to run the types of
applications the types of capabilities
and features that we wanted to achieve
and AWS you know just happens to be
obviously the leader and the types of
services and functionality that we want
and you know as new capabilities and new
features come in into play we're able to
really effectively take advantage of
those by working closely with AWS to
achieve what we need to in terms of
product development and Engineering the
best way I would describe it is AWS
helps curve a be more elastic in the
sense that we can easily grow scale and
build new feature functions by
leveraging what's available to us within
the AWS ecosystem
thank you
